description: A podcast series about maneuvering your 20s, captured in real time. Millennial is a proud member of Radiotopia, from PRX. Learn more at radiotopia.fm.

items.content: Megan is back behind the mic with a brand new podcast Snooze by LAist Studios. She’s still tackling life and dreaming big. So big, that she’s made a podcast dedicated to helping others achieve their goals and dreams. How millennial.

items.title: #46 Sharp Turns

items.content: On today’s episode, something we’ve never done before: a round table. How do you define yourself as an individual while also defining yourself as part of a couple?

items.title: #45 In Cases of Unusual Dependence

items.content: It’s easy to feel overwhelmed when it comes to making decisions. I sit down with Chuck, my boyfriend’s father and a 70-year old swift decision maker, to understand how he approaches big decisions.

items.title: #13 Long Distance Love Story (Rerun)

items.content:
What happens when a judge brands you “unrehabilitatable” at age 28? 

This month, each of the Radiotopia shows is interpreting the theme Doing Time, to welcome the new member of the collective, Ear Hustle. Visit http://radiotopia.fm to hear all the Doing Time episodes, and to subscribe to Ear Hustle – you’ll hear a preview of it at the end of this episode.

items.title: #43 “Unrehabilitatable”

items.content: I love Maine, but sometimes I feel isolated here. Could my creative problems be solved if I moved to New York City?

items.title: #41 Not By Accident

items.content: It’s easy to feel overwhelmed by the endless stream of bad news on social media. But what happens when you stop scrolling and take action?

items.title: #39 Seeing Red and Blue

items.content: My parents have lived in the same house for over 40 years. It’s where we all grew up. But when they want to sell it, we say goodbye to more than just the house.

items.title: #38 We Grew Up Here

items.content: Taxes can be scary and confusing. Maybe it’s because all of that paperwork forces us to take responsibility for our choices. But what happens when the IRS sees you differently than you see yourself?

items.title: #37 Your Tax Return, Yourself

items.content: Is it possible that a country’s policies can change the way people see themselves? How much of your identity is you — and how much of it is your country?

items.title: #36 Patria o Muerte

items.content: Can a woman have it all?  It’s an age-old question. But in Cuba, a country caught between a machismo culture and some of the most progressive policies in the world, the answer isn’t easy.

items.title: #35 Alas Para Volar

items.content: “ Pies Secos, Pies Mojados” or “Wet Foot, Dry Foot.” In the U.S., it’s the nickname of a piece of legislation, but in Cuba, it’s been the key to a dream. To what lengths will Cubans go to make that dream a reality?

items.title: #34 Pies Secos, Pies Mojados

items.content: I’ve always romanticized Cuba as a mysterious forbidden island. But when I go there to visit a friend, I learn growing up on the island is far more complicated than anything I could have expected. This is the first episode of a four-part series on Cuba.

items.title: #33 No Es Fácil

items.content: After a year of making Millennial full-time, my editor Devon and I sit down together to reflect on what’s happened and make a plan for next year. But how do you set goals when you don’t know exactly what you want?

items.title: #32 Auld Lang Syne

items.content: Holidays are stressful, especially in an election year. But things get more complicated when you’re bringing someone home with you ** and even more stressful when you’re the person they’re bringing home. **** How do you successfully maneuver your significant other’s family? **** Make it into a game.**

items.title: #31 Three Turkeys and Some Egg Rolls

items.content: It’s scary to make long-term commitments, but living year-to-year isn’t always comfortable. For the first time, I’m starting to consider the 30-year-plan.

items.title: #30 Thirty-Year Plan

items.content: The plan is to grow up and chase after your dreams, but what if getting closer to your goals means moving farther from your family?

items.title: #28 With Love From The Heart

items.content: I’ve always heard you shouldn’t meet your heroes because they might not live up to your expectations. But is there something to be gained from getting real?

items.title: #26 Werner

items.content: I thought hiring Millennial’s first apprentice would be easy but I quickly realize judging people based on so little information is daunting. How do you decide who’s the right match for you?

items.title: #23 Systems Check

items.content: It’s summer and I want to go outside. So I shut down my computer and go off on an expedition to understand an unknown world unfolding right under my nose — The Poké-world.
items.content:encoded: It’s summer and I want to go outside. So I shut down my computer and go off on an expedition to understand an unknown world unfolding right under my nose — The Poké-world.

items.title: #22 Screw It, I’m Going Outside

items.content: When you move back home with your parents it’s hard to feel like you’re growing up. But what really makes you an adult? And what if parenting an adult child is just as confusing as being your 20s?

items.title: #21 Moving Out

items.content: After college, I thought everyone was on equal footing. But that’s not always the case. How do you come to terms with your own financial status when your close friends are living lives you can’t afford?

items.title: #20 Haves and Have-Mores

items.content: Look around the Internet and you’ll see people sharing intimate thoughts and bearing their souls — including me. Why do we feel more comfortable publishing the secrets of our lives online — but keep them from the people who are closest to us?

items.title: #19 Message in a Bottle

items.content: It’s always been my dream to play with the pros. Now, after months of practicing it all comes down to one game and one decision.

items.title: #18 Nothin’ But Net

items.content:
How do you turn a passion project into a business?

After I quit my job, I have to find out.

The only problem is, I don’t know anything about running a business.

items.content:
For months, I’ve lived a double life and suffered the consequences.

Now, I’m forced to reevaluate what life I want to live.

items.title: #16 Double Life

items.content: Spending most of my savings makes me anxious but when my car dies I don’t have a choice. Luckily, my boyfriend’s father Chuck comes to my rescue and guides me through the world of used cars. Our mission: to find a cheap car that’s not a dud.

items.title: #12 When Would We Get Married?

items.content:
When things aren’t working out the way you had expected,

it’s tempting to jump on an airplane or a boat and leave everything behind. I know a lot of people who have done it, including myself.

items.title: #11 Facebook, Mexico & Peter Pan

items.content:
What’s it like to document your life and make it into a story?

It’s weird, for sure. In this bonus episode, I explain the out-of-body experience I have, my thoughts on vulnerability, and the production process behind putting this show together.

items.title: #9 Becoming More of a Somebody

items.content: Job interviews are stressful, especially when it’s for the position of your dreams and you’re competing against nine other people. But is it worth it to become something you’re not and to play the game so someone will hire you?
